## Figures

### Figure from R code with caption

```{r fig-1}
#| label: "fig-1"
#| fig-cap: "Caption figure 1"
#| fig-width: 4
#| fig-height: 4
#| fig-pos: H

plot(x = testdata$mpg, y = testdata$cyl)

```


### Multiple figures

@fig-3 consists of 2 subplots.

```{r fig-3}
#| label: "fig-3"
#| fig-cap: "Caption figure"
#| fig-subcap: 
#|  - "first subcaption"
#|  - "second subcaption"
#| fig-pos: H
#| layout-ncol: 2

plot(x = testdata$mpg, y = testdata$cyl)
plot(x = testdata$mpg, y = testdata$hp)

```

@fig-4-5 consists op 2 plots, but referencing is broken as there's only one label.

